title: The vortex ring nucleation rate due to negative ions travelling near the Landau velocity in He II.
abstract: Field emission characteristics in He II at temperatures 0.3 < T < 0.8 K and under pressures 10 < P < 25 bar have been used to deduce values of the vortex ring nucleation rate nu in electric fields E of order 3 kV/cm. The values of nu obtained are an order of magnitude larger than those recently determined by Zoll and Schwarz, who employed a completely different technique at the same T and P but with e of order 20 V/cm

        The vortex ring nucleation rate due to negative ions travelling near the Landau velocity in He II.</dc:title><dc:creator>
        Phillips, A.</dc:creator><dc:creator>
        McClintock, Peter V. E.</dc:creator><dc:subject>
        QC Physics</dc:subject><dc:description>
        Field emission characteristics in He II at temperatures 0.3 < T < 0.8 K and under pressures 10 < P < 25 bar have been used to deduce values of the vortex ring nucleation rate nu in electric fields E of order 3 kV/cm. The values of nu obtained are an order of magnitude larger than those recently determined by Zoll and Schwarz, who employed a completely different technique at the same T and P but with e of order 20 V/cm.</dc:description><dc:date>
